website_summaries.verdict: The Canon EF 135mm f/2L USM is a classic portrait lens with sharp optics and an impressive aperture, but it's not optically stabilized.

customer_reviews.title: A brilliant lens
customer_reviews.text: Can't praise this lens enough. It's light, fast and very, very sharp. It has excellent colour rendition and the bokeh is very smooth. I've tried many L lenses and this has got to be one of the best ones, and unlike say the 85mm f/1.2 there's no learning curve with it. Just take it out and use it. I use it for street photography when I want to isolate a subject from the background, and at motorsports events for the back story (pits, etc). It's excellent for portraits, low light candid shots, etc, etc. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Shaun Pugh

customer_reviews.title: Simply the most awesome lens I own - shot over 300 weddings on ...
customer_reviews.text: Simply the most awesome lens I own - shot over 300 weddings on this now. Took a while to get used to the sweet spot and as a tip it locks much quicker in the centre focal point and I up the shutter speed to min 200. Get stunning results every time now
customer_reviews.author: andrew71

customer_reviews.title: Lovely optics on this and surprisingly small and light weight ...
customer_reviews.text: Lovely optics on this and surprisingly small and light weight. I can now leave the 70-200 2.8 behind a lot of the time and be much less tired at the end of a long day shooting. Af minimum distance is much closer than the big lens as well and it focuses a little bit quicker in low light.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Huston

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Buy it. Forgive me for not posting a technical review....I wouldn't know where to start anyway Words can't describe the sharpness and colours you will achieve with this lens. I was overwhelmed when I first saw the portraits I was producing and have several framed on the wall. Never take anything else to the park with the kids. It is extremely forgiving and has become my walkaround lens.
customer_reviews.author: Mike London

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing that I can say about this lens that hasn't been said already. It gorgeous and has a personality that is so easily adored. If you have debated buying this for a while just buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Alan Smith

customer_reviews.title: great quality
customer_reviews.text: The lens is so sharp i have cut myself on it, great quality
customer_reviews.author: KaloMemories

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful !
customer_reviews.text: Every mm as good as everybody says it is !
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: One of the best lenses I ever had
customer_reviews.text: why did I not buy this lens before. Absolutely amazingly sharp and just awesome bokeh etc.
customer_reviews.author: Idan B.

customer_reviews.title: A great buy. Get it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this lens for portraits and street photography - and there is only one way to say it, it does the job! Perfectly. Sharp. Fast. A great buy. Get it!
customer_reviews.author: PixieCat

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It captures images beautifully! A must get for bokeh images
customer_reviews.author: AAK

customer_reviews.title: An excellent lens, great for getting background blur on a ...
customer_reviews.text: An excellent lens, great for getting background blur on a focussed subject. Expensive to a degree, but it certainly wont disappoint,
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great quality portrait lens with incredible bokeh and applause ergonomics.
customer_reviews.author: m4tek

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful lens; if you have a use for this focal lens then you will never regret owning this lens.
customer_reviews.author: JustcallmeJohn

customer_reviews.title: sharp
customer_reviews.text: uber sharp lens.i pretty much only use it at f2 great background blur.great value for a 135mm lens....just buy it
customer_reviews.author: phunkt.com

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely AMAZING lens!! A must have for your professional kit!
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Lord of the Red Ring Indeed!
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing lens! I was torn between this and the 100L macro. After testing a 100L for a week (which I borrowed from a friend) I just was'nt blown away, although this is a great lens in its own right. I'am a wedding and portrait photographer and this lens is in it's element, The 135 is an AWESOME lens if you 're using a full frame body (I use a 5d MK II and 1ds MKIII). Kudos to the seller. Super fast delivery at an amazing price
customer_reviews.author: Arun Sundar

customer_reviews.title: Simply a Fantastic Prime Lens
customer_reviews.text: I can't add anything to the comprehensive reviews others have written. Save to say this is a truly, truly excellent prime lens. I simply cannot rate it higher. It's worth every single penny.
customer_reviews.author: RMB

customer_reviews.title: fantastic portrait lens, especially for candid work
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this lens for almost 4 years now & can honestly say it's probably my most loved lens in my current collection. I favour it over the 70-200 f/2.8 is II as the larger aperture makes for a more versatile offering indoors and in reduced light conditions. Also, the fact that it's smaller & black rather than white is a tremendous advantage when trying to capture more candid scenes, especially portraits, which given the 135mm focal length is what this lens excels at in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: MR SMR

customer_reviews.title: The best prime lens there is.
customer_reviews.text: Simply the sharpest lens I've ever used. Rapid snap into focus. Wide enough aperture to get background well out of focus. My first choice for portraits and, on a smaller sensor body for much garden wildlife. I don't think there is a better prime lens on the market, and that includes Nikon, Leica etc.
customer_reviews.author: Raj

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic lens
customer_reviews.text: I have a few L lenses and this is by far and way the best and fully deserves it's cult status in terms of sharpness and colours. It's very rare you will see this lens given any less than 5 stars and it sits within a very select group of primes which includes the 200mm f2 and the 85mm f1.2. There are rumours of a mark II coming out at some point but it very hard to see how they can improve on this. It is expensive but if you have other lenses collecting dust, sell them and get this instead.
customer_reviews.author: matthew

customer_reviews.title: My go to portrait lens
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal lens. My go to portrait lens even though I own the expensive 85mm lens too. Simply prefer the flattering way it flattens faces. V sharp. V reliable.
customer_reviews.author: The Spyridon

customer_reviews.title: One of Canon's best prime lenses
customer_reviews.text: This is quite possibly one of the best prime lenses you can buy, particularly for the full-frame series (e.g. 5D). The quality is superb, it focusses quickly and accurately even in low-light indoor conditions, the range is perfect for candid party shots, and it's extremely versatile - portraits, snapshots, still-life, landscapes, pretty much anything you can throw at it. The only thing you may not like is being on the receiving end, as the lens element has an eerie irridescent green glow to it which can be quite intimidating! Bear in mind that on a cropped sensor camera (e.g. 30D, 400D, etc.) this will be the equivalent of a 216mm lens which may not be quite as useful indoors.
customer_reviews.author: Mark P.

customer_reviews.title: One word: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: That's the first L lens i bought, i've had it for over a year and a half now and i'm madly in love with it! It's incredibly sharp and fast, the bokeh is beautiful and smooth.. The built quality is flawless, i've been traveling a lot with it, using it under during the summer by 35°C+, and in Finland by -30°C. It's also really polyvalent, extremely good for portrait, but also for landscapes or architecture in some conditions... Highly recommended, worth the money! :)
customer_reviews.author: Charléli

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful lens
customer_reviews.text: In the best part of 30 years photography I have owned kit from many of the best camera makers, and I can honestly say I have NEVER seen better results than those provided by the Canon 135L. A classic lens giving simply amazing optical speed and sharpness. If you need a "people" telephoto I would look really long and hard at this 135L, a magnificent piece of kit.
customer_reviews.author: Night photographer
